procedure.summary: Remove impurities by boiling the ears.
procedure.description: To remove any potential scum or impurities, pour 1 litre (2.1 US pt) of water into a pot then heat it until it's boiling. Once the water comes to a boil, put the ears into the pot then boil them for 5 minutes.

procedure.summary: Add the ears, vegetables, and aromatics into a separate pan.
procedure.description: Remove the pig's ears from the boiling water and place them into a separate pot. Add enough water to cover the ears. Then, add 1 diced shallot, 1 diced carrot, 1/2 of a leek, 1 bay leaf, a sprig of thyme, and 6 peppercorns.

Now that all the ingredients are together, raise the heat to a low simmer and cook the dish for 2.5 hours. Make sure to check that the ears are completely submerged every so often. You can tell if the ears are cooked when a knife can easily pass through the flesh.

procedure.summary: Remove the ears and allow them to cool.
procedure.description: With a pair of tongs, remove the ears from the pan and place them between 2 sheets of greaseproof or wax paper pressed down by some weights. The paper will prevent the ears from sticking as they cool.

procedure.summary: Prepare the dusting while the ears cool.
procedure.description: Fill 1 bowl with 100 grams (3.5 oz) (1 cup) of plain flour, another with 2 eggs and 50 millilitres (0.21  c) of whole milk, and the final bowl with panko breadcrumbs.

procedure.summary: Slice the ears, then dust them.
procedure.description: Once cool, remove the greaseproof or wax paper from the ears then slice them into thin wafers. Dust each slice thoroughly in the flour bowl first. Then, coat the slice in the contents of the egg bowl, then coat them in the breadcrumbs.Then, set aside the strips.

procedure.summary: Deep-fry the strips for about 5 minutes.
procedure.description: In a deep-fat fryer, heat vegetable oil to 180 °C (356 °F). Then, deep fry the pig ear strips until they are golden brown. This usually takes around 5 minutes, but can vary depending on the size of the strips and the amount of batter. Drain the oil, season the strips with salt and pepper, then serve them for a tasty and dignified meal.
